A control input file

Shown is the complete ``control.txt" file. The filenames may be entered as paths. For example, if the map and match files were in a subdirectory named ``data", the names would read, e.g. ``datamap1.txt" on a Unix system and would read ``data map1.txt" on a Windows system. 
-maps
1     data/map1.txt
2     data/map2.txt
3     data/map3.txt
4     data/map4.txt
5     data/map5.txt
-matches
1     1     data/match1v1.txt
2     1     data/match2v1.txt
3     1     data/match3v1.txt
4     1     data/match4v1.txt
5     1     data/match5v1.txt
1     2     data/match1v2.txt
2     2     data/match2v2.txt
3     2     data/match3v2.txt
4     2     data/match4v2.txt
5     2     data/match5v2.txt
1     3     data/match1v3.txt
2     3     data/match2v3.txt
3     3     data/match3v3.txt
4     3     data/match4v3.txt
5     3     data/match5v3.txt
1     4     data/match1v4.txt
2     4     data/match2v4.txt
3     4     data/match3v4.txt
4     4     data/match4v4.txt
5     4     data/match5v4.txt
1     5     data/match1v5.txt
2     5     data/match2v5.txt
3     5     data/match3v5.txt
4     5     data/match4v5.txt
5     5     data/match5v5.txt
